sentences.sContent: Add fertilizer to enrich the soil.
Education can greatly enrich your life.
sentences.sCn: 教育可以大大充实生活。

sentences.sContent: ...But Bowman's supporters argue that Monsanto is trying to expand the scope of patents in ways that would enrich big corporations and hurt small farmers...
...there are those who just want to enrich their life by preparing for the certificates because they really enjoy their progress...

remMethod.val: en(使…) ＋ rich(富有的) → 使富有

words.tran: 丰富；改进；肥沃；发财致富

trans.tranCn: 充实， 使丰富； 使富裕， 使富有
trans.tranOther: to improve the quality of something, especially by adding things to it
